CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 29, 1973, pg. 24, reads: "Sharing Toys - Headed by Miss Naomi Thomas, head of Inner-City Services at Carnegie Library, members of the Project Outreach staff assist a group of children who have little themselves, share a toy with others less fortunate. They are shown here helping to load a van with toys to go to the Salvation Army for distribution.  Miss Thomas is on the steps (next to driver) Sam Kirkland who has been driving the van for the project since 1968. - Harris photo.'
TitMainTitle: Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh Project Outreach staff including driver Sam Kirkland standing next to Naomi Thomas, posed with children holding toys for "Books by Bus" for Salvation Army
